wikipedia_page.main: Daniel Jarlath Carey (2 June 1932 – 4 October 2006) was a Northern Irish sportsperson.  He played Gaelic football with his local club Dundrum and was a member of the Down senior inter-county team from the 1950s until the 1960s.  Carey won back-to-back All-Ireland titles with Down in 1960 and 1961. He later served as a Social Democratic and Labour Party councillor on Down District Council from 1977 to 1981.

response: *5 October – Jarlath Carey, 74, former Down Gaelic footballer.
